name: physeter-macrocephalus
definition: A very large toothed whale formerly hunted for the spermaceti in its massive head and the ambergris in its intestines.
description:
The sperm whale is the largest of the toothed whales and the largest toothed predator.

Mature males average 16 meters in length but some may reach 20.7 meters, with the head representing up to one-third of the animal's length.

Sperm whales are large animals that can weight between 35 and 57 tons. Males are larger than females.

Sperm whale can swim at the speed of 35 to 45 kilometers per hour.

Plunging to 2,250 meters, it is the second deepest diving mammal, exceeded only by Cuvier's beaked whale.

Sperm whales live in every ocean in the world but stay away from the extremely cold waters near the polar ice in the north and the south.

Females usually remain in temperate and tropical waters within 45 to 55° latitude, whereas males travel in temperate waters.

Sperm whales prefer deep water around ocean trenches, where strong currents bring concentrated nutrients, attracting a large number of creatures that the sperm whales can eat.

Cephalopods like squid, octopus and cuttlefish, make up the majority of sperm whale diet.

The sperm whale also hunts the largest invertebrates on earth: the giant and colossal squids, active hunters with deadly tentacles.

While hunting giant squids, sperm whale can dive to the depth of more than 1000 meters.

The voracious sperm whale needs to eat over a ton of food every day.

A mature sperm whale has few natural predators, although calves and weakened adults are sometimes killed by pods of killer whales.

Mating occurs in spring and summer, and males may battle for herds of females.

Females carry their young for 14 to 16 months, and calves are 4 meters long and weigh about one ton when born.

They nurse for two years, but may continue nursing intermittently for up to eight years!

Females give birth every three to five years.

Young adult males will leave female-led pods and form bachelor herds until they are able to compete in mating, at about 20 years old.

The females cooperate to protect and nurse their young.

The sperm whale is a pelagic mammal with a worldwide range, and will migrate seasonally for feeding and breeding.

Females and young males live together in groups, while mature males (bulls) live solitary lives, outside of the mating season.

The sperm whale uses echolocation and vocalization as loud as 230 decibels.

featured.caption:
There are proves that giant killer sperm whales once cruised Australia's waters.

In our days sperm whales are the largest predator on the planet.

trivia.caption: Moby Dick is a fictional sperm whale who is the main antagonist in Herman Melville's 1851 novel of the same name.

sampleTitle: Sperm whales clicks used for hydro location

facts.name: Sperm whales live in groups called pods
facts.value: Sperm whales live in groups called pods. They are composed of sexually mature females and their offspring. Males are usually solitary, except during the mating season.

facts.name: Can spend 90 minutes under the water
facts.value: Sperm whale can spend 90 minutes under the water, without returning to the surface of the water to breathe.

facts.name: Pregnancy lasts 14 to 16 months
facts.value: Pregnancy lasts 14 to 16 months and ends with a single baby. Mother takes care of the baby during the first 2 years of its life.

facts.name: Mating season during the summer
facts.value: Mating season takes place during the summer. Male joins the pod of females and mate with all sexually mature individuals.

facts.name: Name derived from the spermaceti organ
facts.value: Sperm whales were named because of the organ located in their heads known as spermaceti. This organ produces large quantity of waxy substance (oil) that regulates whale's buoyancy.

facts.name: Have between 18 to 30 conical teeth
facts.value: Sperm whales have between 18 to 30 conical teeth in their tiny lower jaw.

facts.name: Has a single blowhole
facts.value: Unlike other whales, sperm whale has a single blowhole that is located on the left side of the head. Condensed air is blown forward and under the angle, which helps in identification of the sperm whale from a distance.

facts.name: Bluish-gray, or light brown wrinkled skin
facts.value: Sperm whales have bluish-gray, or light brown wrinkled skin. Their large, squared head makes one third of the total body size.

facts.name: Small eyes and poor eyesight
facts.value: Sperm whales have small eyes and their eyesight is poor. However, even blind whales are able to find food thanks to echolocation. This technique consists of producing clicks and listening of the returning sounds (after bouncing off the objects in front of them). By using echolocation sperm whales can detect prey without using their eyes.

facts.name: Giant squids represent 80% of the diet
facts.value: 80% of the sperm whale's diet consists of giant squids. Battle between these two gigantic creatures often leaves sperm whales with large scars. Other than giant squids, sperm whales eat fish, octopus, shrimps, crabs and sharks that are living on the bottom of the ocean.

facts.name: Sexual maturity depends on body size
facts.value: Sexual maturity of sperm whales depends on their size. Females are able to become pregnant as soon as they reach the length of 28 feet. Males are ready for mating when they reach the size of 39 feet.

related.definition: The blue whale  is a marine mammal belonging to the baleen whale parvorder, Mysticeti.
A baleen whale that arches its back when it dives, has long knobby flippers and a small dorsal fin, and communicates with complex songs.
The killer whale or orca  is a toothed whale belonging to the oceanic dolphin family, of which it is the largest member.
The common minke whale is a species of minke whale within the suborder of baleen whales.
The beluga whale   is an Arctic and sub-Arctic cetacean.
The fin whale , also known as finback whale or common rorqual and formerly known as herring whale or razorback whale, is a cetacean belonging to the parvorder of baleen whales.
Cuvier's beaked whale is the most widely distributed of all the beaked whales.
